short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Shows YouTube sentiment based off of the likes to view ratio

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Shows projected viewer sentiment underneath YouTube videos by looking at the Like to View ratio. Like to View ratio is intended to be a substitute for looking at the soon to be removed like bar. Videos with a red stoplight (so "low" like to view ratio) can be seen as being generally "disliked." Not "voting" on a video with a like in a sense will be seen as a silent dislike of the video.

If the like to view ratio is greater than 3%, a green circle is shown next to the like button.
If the like to view ratio is greater than 1%, a yellow circle is shown next to the like button.
If the like to view ratio is less than 1%, a red circle is shown next to the like button.

All of these ranges are customizable by hitting the Stoplight icon.
